alert.note: Alert for Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 10:53AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARIPOSA... SOUTHEASTERN TUOLUMNE AND NORTHEASTERN MADERA COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM PDT... At 1052 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yosemite Valley, or 13 miles northeast of Yosemite South Entrance, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Yosemite Valley, Yosemite Glacier Point, Merced Lake High Sierra Camp, Sunrise High Sierra Camp, Ostrander Lake, Little Yosemite Valley Campground, Merced Lake Ranger Station, Bridalveil Creek Campground, Little Yosemite Valley Ranger Station, Morraine Dome Campground, Buck Camp Ranger Station, and Upper Pines Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley
